intro: Scutellaria antirrhinoides, commonly known as the purple skullcap, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, two-lipped blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shady environments. Scutellaria antirrhinoides is often found in the understory of forests, where it contributes to the biodiversity of native plant communities.
